Key Match Events: Matt Wallner homered for the second straight game
Brooks Lee snapped an 0-for-19 stretch with a go-ahead, two-run double
Royce Lewis nearly had his sixth career grand slam
Willi Castro had an RBI single to snap an 0-for-16 skid during a three-run fourth inning
Jordyn Adams added his first career homer
Pre-Game Insights: Minnesota manager Rocco Baldelli emphasized the importance of strong offense
Los Angeles manager Ron Washington discussed the team's injuries, including Brandon Drury's left hamstring tightness and Bryce Teodosio's small finger fracture
Post-Match Reflections: Wallner said the team feels good after back-to-back wins
Baldelli praised the team's good energy and at-bats
Kochanowicz said he needs to be better with his breaking balls
Adams said he was focused on getting the ball in play
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Twins remain six games behind Cleveland and 1 1/2 behind Kansas City in the AL Central
They are three ahead of Detroit for the final AL wild-card spot
Jhoan Duran secured his 23rd save despite surrendering three hits in the ninth
Several Twins players were reinstated from the injured list, including Byron Buxton, Manuel Margot, and Christian VÃ¡zquez
Others: The game was played at Target Field in Minneapolis, Minnesota, with a attendance of 15,660
The Angels have lost four of five games, while the Twins have back-to-back wins after losing six of their previous seven games
